com.github.restdriver.clientdriver.jetty

Class DefaultClientDriverJettyHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.AbstractLifeCycle
      • org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.ContainerLifeCycle
        • org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.AbstractHandler
          • com.github.restdriver.clientdriver.jetty.DefaultClientDriverJettyHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ClientDriverJettyHandler, org.eclipse.jetty.server.Handler, org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.Container, org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.Destroyable, org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.Dumpable, org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.LifeCycle

    public final class DefaultClientDriverJettyHandler
extends org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.AbstractHandler
implements ClientDriverJettyHandler
    Class which acts as a Jetty Handler to see if the actual incoming HTTP request matches any expectation and to act accordingly. In case of any kind of error, ClientDriverInternalException is usually thrown.

    • Method Detail

      • handle

        public void handle(String target,
                   org.eclipse.jetty.server.Request baseRequest,
                   javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                   javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
            throws IOException,
                   javax.servlet.ServletException

        This implementation uses the expected ClientDriverRequest/ ClientDriverResponse pairs to serve its requests. If an unexpected request comes in, a ClientDriverInternalException is thrown.

        Specified by:
        handle in interface org.eclipse.jetty.server.Handler
        Throws:
        IOException
        javax.servlet.ServletException

      • noFailFastOnUnexpectedRequest

        public void noFailFastOnUnexpectedRequest()
        Description copied from interface: ClientDriverJettyHandler
